item.title: Introducing OpenWISP2
item.description: Aw yeah, another blog post! I was actually writing a post about open source competitions, but I moved that aside in favour of this one. Introducing OpenWISP2. What’s OpenWISP2? In short, it’s a set of tools to help create and manage networking devices. It might seem a bit boring at first. Why do I need to use more software just to control my network? you may ask. Well, OpenWISP might not prove useful for a network made of a single router and a few nodes, but once your network scales to tens or even hundreds of routers and devices, it’ll be a hassle configuring and fixing things if something goes wrong, or if you simply want to change a setting and apply it to all the devices.
